numbered_ace_sentences: 1. The top left of the graph is labeled about 15-24-year-olds.
2. The label asks if 15-24-year-olds think that the world is getting better with each generation.
3. The graph also states the opinions of 40-year-olds.
4. The statement about 40-year-olds asks if the world is getting better.
5. We noticed that the socioeconomic condition of a country did not determine the belief that the world is getting better.
6. There was great variation across countries.
7. The countries had different socioeconomic conditions.
8. Some chosen countries are very small.
9. Some chosen countries are very big.
10. I ask why these countries were chosen.
11. Some countries have data for certain age groups.
12. Some countries do not have data for both age groups.
13. I ask why both age groups were not evaluated in all countries.
14. About 65% of people in the US think that each generation is improving.
15. About 35% of people in the US do not think that each generation is improving.
16. Societal issues influence beliefs about whether generations are getting better.
17. The US is a first world country.
18. This fact can allow a more positive outlook.
19. The headline is: World for Better or Worse?
